title: How to Reduce Forehead Wrinkles With Face Yoga

steps.title: Sit up straight and take a deep breath.
steps.content: Sit up straight and take a deep breath. [1] X Expert Source Susana Jones, C-IAYT Certified Yoga Therapist & Educator Expert Interview. 4 March 2020. While the lion face is a great facial workout, it also helps relax the rest of your body. Making sure you are sitting up straight and taking a deep breath beforehand will ensure the exercise is effective. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Constrict everything.
steps.content: Constrict everything. While breathing in, try to tense every muscle in your body. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Make the lion face.
steps.content: Make the lion face. When you exhale, slowly relax your muscles, stick out your tongue, open your eyes wide, and splay your hands wide. [4] X Research source [5] X Research source Don't just stick your tongue straight out. Try to point it downward while grinning or opening your mouth wide. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Hold the lion face.
steps.content: Hold the lion face. Hold this position for five to ten seconds. [7] X Research source To get the maximum benefit for forehead wrinkles, make sure your eyes are wide open.

steps.title: Relax and repeat.
steps.content: Relax and repeat. Relax your whole body for a few seconds, and then repeat this exercise a minimum of three times. [8] X Research source On the last repetition, try to hold the position for a full minute. This is a great tension-relieving exercise that also stretches your entire face and improves circulation to the face. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Make a V with both hands.
steps.content: Make a V with both hands. Pretend you are making a peace sign or a V with the index and middle finger of both hands. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Use the V or peace symbol to frame each eye.
steps.content: Use the V or peace symbol to frame each eye. Move your fingers so that your eye is in the middle of each V, with your middle fingers just below the bridge of your nose near the inner corner of your eye. At the same time, place your index fingers so that they are touching the outer corner of your upper eyelids. [11] X Research source It will look like you are holding your eyes open with your middle and index finger. When you look in the mirror, it should look like your fingers form a V below each eye.

steps.title: Look up toward the ceiling while squinting.
steps.content: Look up toward the ceiling while squinting. Look up toward the ceiling while you form squint hard with your eyes. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Push up with your fingers.
steps.content: Push up with your fingers. Use your fingers, or the V shapes you've formed, to push upward while you squint. This exercises your eyebrow and forehead muscles, working them against the resistance of your fingers. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Squeeze your eyes shut.
steps.content: Squeeze your eyes shut. Remove your fingers and squeeze your eyes shut tight. Hold this position for ten seconds and then release. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Relax and repeat.
steps.content: Relax and repeat. After you perform the exercise once, relax your facial muscles for a few seconds and then repeat the exercise six more times, making sure to squeeze your eyes shut and relax between repetitions. In addition to reducing forehead wrinkles, this exercise also helps prevent puffy and baggy eyes, drooping eyelids, and crow's feet, so use it in conjunction with the other exercises and make it part of your anti-aging ritual.

steps.title: Make a C shape with each hand.
steps.content: Make a C shape with each hand. Imagine you are holding a pair of binoculars up to your eyes. [15] X Research source Your thumbs should be below your eyes, while your index fingers are just above your eyebrows.

steps.title: Use your index fingers to pull the skin on your forehead down.
steps.content: Use your index fingers to pull the skin on your forehead down. Apply firm pressure against your forehead with your index fingers. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Try to raise your eyebrows upwards and open your eyes wide.
steps.content: Try to raise your eyebrows upwards and open your eyes wide. You will have to work against your fingers to accomplish this task. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Hold this position for two seconds.
steps.content: Hold this position for two seconds. Apply downward pressure for two seconds. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Relax and repeat.
steps.content: Relax and repeat. Relax the position of your hands and your eyebrows. Repeat this exercise 3 more times. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Hold for ten seconds on the last repetition.
steps.content: Hold for ten seconds on the last repetition. On your last repetition, hold the position for ten seconds, which will strengthen and tighten the forehead muscles. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat daily.
steps.content: Repeat daily. Perform this exercise daily along with the other facial yoga poses discussed in the article so that your forehead is smooth and line-free. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Rest your hands gently on your forehead.
steps.content: Rest your hands gently on your forehead. Make sure your fingers are pointing inward, and facing each other.

steps.title: Swipe your fingers outward across your forehead.
steps.content: Swipe your fingers outward across your forehead. While you move your fingers from the middle of your forehead toward your temples, apply pressure to smooth out the skin on your forehead. Imagine you are sweeping away your forehead wrinkles. Don't be afraid to apply firm pressure. You want to feel some resistance from the skin while you perform this exercise. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Relax your facial muscles.
steps.content: Relax your facial muscles. Now that you've completed one repetition, briefly rest your facial muscles.

steps.title: Repeat ten times daily.
steps.content: Repeat ten times daily. Instead of resorting to botox, repeat this exercise ten times every day to reduce horizontal forehead lines. This is a good recovery exercise for the end of your workout.

steps.title: Use with other exercises.
steps.content: Use with other exercises. Combine this exercise with some of the others discussed in this article to more effectively reduce forehead wrinkles.
